title: Elo -/+ issues
body:
I dont get how the elo gaining/loss system works, but these days Im starting to see how it is getting so inconsistent.

Some games your whole team gains 25~30 lp and enemy team loses 20+

and other games win +10~12 and lose the same amount. 

I would like to know the reason behind it. If anyone knows please let me know.

replies.body:
LP gain is based off of a number called MMR (match-making rating). This number is a rough indicator of that player's skill, which is calculated off of all their previous games and whether they won or lost. It's basically a more accurate version of league/division. When you are waiting in queue, you're matched with people of similar MMR to you, and then the teams are distributed to have the closest amount of total MMR spread among each team.

Of course, there will be instances where one team has more MMR than the other. In those cases, the team with higher MMR is the "favourite" to win. If your team is not the favourite to win, but you win anyway, then you will gain significantly more LP for that match as you were expected to lose. Same thing vice-versa.

In some rare cases, the MMR difference is extreme and the LP rewards are changed very unexpectedly (like, only 1 LP gain for a win and 50 LP loss for losing.) This are fortunately *rare*.
